docs.summary: Members service

permissions.name: Manage Members
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change member data.

docs.summary:
Creates a site member.

After creation, the new member will be unable to log in
until they set their password.
Send email to member to set their password using
[Send Set Password Email](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/drafts/member-authentication/authentication/send-set-password-email).

Read more about the member creation flow in
[Create Member Flow]().

Note: When adding profile.photo, only one of profile.photo.id or profile.photo.url must be defined.

>This endpoint will be deprecated in the near future and replaced with another endpoint.

docs.summary:
Deletes a member.

<!--ONLY:VELO
This function returns a Promise that resolves to a `Member` object
when the requested member is deleted.

> **Note:**
> This function replaces the legacy
> `deleteUser()` from `wix-users-backend`.
> The legacy function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
>
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes,
> see the migration instructions at
> [`wix-users-backend.deleteUser()`](wix-users-backend/deleteUser).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

`deleteMemberAddresses()` clears the `addresses` array under the `contact` property.

- `"PUBLIC"`: Returns `_id` and all fields under `profile`.

> are returned as `"UNKNOWN"`.

extra.description: Retrieving my member with provided FULL fieldSet

docs.summary:
Joins the currently logged-in member to the site community and their profile to public.

<!--ONLY:VELO
This function returns a Promise that resolves to a `Member` object
when the member's profile privacy is updated.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

When a member's profile is public,
they have access to the site's
[Members Area](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-members-area)
features — such as chat, forum, and followers —
and their profile is visible to other members and site visitors.

Removes the currently logged-in member from the site community and sets their profile to private.

<!--ONLY:VELO
This function returns a Promise that resolves to a `Member` object
when the member's profile privacy is updated.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

When a member's profile is private,
they do not have access to the site's
[Members Area](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-members-area)
features — such as chat, forum, and followers —
and their profile is hidden from other members and site visitors.

> **Note:**
> If a public member profile changes to private —
> in other words, if a member leaves the site's community —
> their content such as forum posts and blog comments remain publicly visible.

permissions.name: Read Members
permissions.description: Request permission to read member data.

params.name: paging.limit
params.doc: The number of items to load

params.name: paging.offset
params.doc: number of items to skip in the current sort order

docs.summary:
List site members, given the providing paging and fieldSet.
- PUBLIC fieldSet returns: ID and profile object (status, privacyStatus and activityStatus will return with UNKNOWN values).
- FULL fieldSet returns: ID, status, contact object, profile object, privacyStatus, activityStatus, createdDate and updatedDate.

extra.description: Retrieving members with provided FULL fieldSet

permissions.name: Read Members
permissions.description: Request permission to read member data.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of up to 100 members, given the provided filters, fieldSets, sorting and paging.
- PUBLIC fieldSet returns: ID and profile object (status, privacyStatus and activityStatus will return with UNKNOWN values).
- FULL fieldSet returns: ID, status, contact object, profile object, privacyStatus, activityStatus, createdDate and updatedDate.

Currently supported fields for filtering:
- id
- profile.nickname
- profile.slug
- contact.firstName
- contact.lastName
- privacyStatus
- loginEmail
- createdDate
- status
- groupId
- role

Currently supported fields for sorting:
- profile.nickname
- contact.firstName
- contact.lastName
- createdDate
- logonDate

extra.description: Retrieving members with ID and provided FULL fieldSet

permissions.description: Request permission to read member data.

docs.summary:
Updates a member's properties.

<!--ONLY:VELO
This function returns a Promise that resolves to a `Member` object
when the requested member is updated.

> **Note:**
> This function replaces the legacy
> `updateUserFields()` from `wix-users-backend`.
> The legacy function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
>
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes,
> see the migration instructions at
> [`wix-users-backend.updateUserFields()`](wix-users-backend/updateUserFields).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

Only the requested fields are updated.

<!--ONLY:VELO
To clear the member's addresses, emails, or phone numbers,
use these functions:

- To clear `contact.addresses`, use
[`deleteMemberAddresses()`](wix-members-backend/members-obj/deletememberaddresses).
- To clear `contact.emails`, use
[`deleteMemberEmails()`](wix-members-backend/members-obj/deletememberemails).
- To clear `contact.phones`, use
[`deleteMemberPhones()`](wix-members-backend/members-obj/deletememberphones).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->
Triggered when a member is approved.

docs.summary: Contact info associated with the member.
Street address.
Member Profile

members.name: nickname
members.doc:
Name that identifies the member to other members.
Displayed on the member's profile page
and interactions in the forum or blog.

members.name: slug
members.doc: Slug that determines the member's profile page URL.

members.name: cover
members.doc:
Member's cover photo,
used as a background picture in members profile page.

Cover positioning can be altered with `cover.offsetX` and `cover.offsetY`.
When left empty, the values default to `0`.

members.name: loginEmail
members.doc: Email used by the member to log in to the site.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Member site access status.

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:

- `"PENDING"`: Member created and is waiting for approval by site owner.
- `"APPROVED"`: Member can log in to the site.
- `"OFFLINE"`: Member is a
[guest author](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-blog-adding-guest-authors-to-your-blog)
for the site blog and cannot log in to the site.
- `"BLOCKED"`: Member is blocked and cannot log in to the site.
- `"UNKNOWN"`: Insufficient permissions to get the status.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: contact
members.doc:
Member's contact info from the site's
 [Contact List](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fcontacts).

members.name: privacyStatus
members.doc:
Member privacy status.

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:

- `"PUBLIC"`: Member is visible to everyone.
- `"PRIVATE"`: Member is hidden from site visitors and other site members.
Member is returned only to site contributors
and apps with the appropriate permissions.
- `"UNKNOWN"`: Insufficient permissions to get the status.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: activityStatus
members.doc:
Member activity status.

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:

- `"ACTIVE"`: Member can write forum posts and blog comments.
- `"MUTED"`: Member cannot write forum posts or blog comments.
- `"UNKNOWN"`: Insufficient permissions to get the status.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Datetime when the member was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Datetime when the member was updated.

members.name: lastLoginDate
members.doc: Datetime when the member last logged in to the site.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: offset
members.doc: number of items to skip in the current sort order

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: A flag that indicates the server failed to calculate 'total' field

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: previousEntityAsJson
members.doc:
This field is currently part of the of the EntityUpdatedEvent msg, but scala/node libraries which implements the domain events standard
 wont populate it / have any reference to it in the API.
 The main reason for it is that fetching the old entity from the DB will have a performance hit on an update operation so unless truly needed,
 the developer should send only the new (current) entity.
 An additional reason is not wanting to send this additional entity over the wire (kafka) since in some cases it can be really big
Developers that must reflect the old entity will have to implement their own domain event sender mechanism which will follow the DomainEvent proto message.

members.name: id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dipatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
 Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dipatching

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
 For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • PENDING
  • APPROVED
  • BLOCKED
  • OFFLINE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • PRIVATE
  • PUBLIC

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACTIVE
  • MUTED

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • PUBLIC - Public properties of the entity
  • FULL - Full entity defined in the doc
